abstract: Hot stories today from Microsoft, Apple, Palm, Buy.com, Dell and more.
snippet: Hot stories today from Microsoft, Apple, Palm, Buy.com, Dell and more.
lead_paragraph: Dell bought Zing, a consumer electronics software company. Dell’s other consumer electronics ventures, like the Dell DJ MP3 player, have been flops. [GigaOm, Release]

headline.main: Quick Bits: Dell Tries Zing, Steve Case Sells Lime, Palm Hears Silence

abstract: Upgraded iMacs, iLife, iWork and .Mac leads to a modest frenzy over some modest features.
snippet: Upgraded iMacs, iLife, iWork and .Mac leads to a modest frenzy over some modest features.
lead_paragraph: Sometimes you feel like Steve Jobs could hold a press conference on the beach and declare this morning’s tides the greatest movement of water in history. As regularly as the tides, Apple, like all technology companies, upgrades its products to take advantage of new and cheaper parts. And, like all fashion companies, it changes the look of its line to make its customers lust after the latest thing.

headline.main: The Event at Apple Is About Events (in More Ways Than One)

abstract: There appears to be a great desire to believe that Fake Steve Jobs just might be the real one. Reaction and counterreaction to the unveiling of the Apple chief’s alter ego.
snippet: There appears to be a great desire to believe that Fake Steve Jobs just might be the real one. Reaction and counterreaction to the unveiling of the Apple chief’s alter ego.
lead_paragraph: Brad Stone pulled the wraps off of Fake Steve Jobs before Dan Lyons, a.k.a. Fake Steve, and Forbes, his employer, could pull the wraps off Fake Steve Jobs on their own. That got a lot of people in a lather, as you can see from the comments to the blog post about the article.
